page.title: 10FOOD IN NORTH YATE
page.content: Almost everybody buys most of their food from Tesco's, the big supermarket in the shopping centre. Quite a lot of people grow some of their own food, particularly fruit and vegetables. One person in the area manages to grow all of these in their garden: beans,potatoes, cucumber,lettuce,parsnip,apricots, peaches,onions,raspberries,rhubarb, peppers and aubergines. Not many people keep animals, but a few keep hens or ducks for eggs, or goats for milk. Most people now own a freezer. The usual time for the main meal of the day is early evening, about 6.00pm. Brown bread is much more popular than white bread in this area. A lot of families regard their Sunday roast dinner as the favourite meal of the week. Most people go out to eat no more than twice a month.
